Not sure if this is one for the unit testing group or for here, but 
I'll start here and jump ship if necessary.

Has anyone had any success implementing a compile/package/test/deploy 
XP type build process with J2ME ?

I've been using ANT, j2meunit and a few other resources and although 
I can compile, preverify and package everything, I'm having trouble 
with the testing stage.

How do you run tests from the command line that use native 
functionality such as Connections and Persistent storage ? My code 
compiles but throws resource exceptions when it tries to (for 
example) create a database. I presume this is because the MIDP 
classes call native functions and the emulator has some reference to 
a dll somewhere that the test classes aren't aware of.

Has anyone got much experience with this ? Any solutions ?
